thread.title: Tiffany Trump accepts Whoopi Goldberg's invitation to sit next to her at New York Fashion Week
thread.title_full: Tiffany Trump accepts Whoopi Goldberg's invitation to sit next to her at New York Fashion Week

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Tiffany Trump accepts Whoopi Goldberg's invitation to sit next to her at New York Fashion Week

organizations.name: new york fashion week showbiz tiffany trump

text:
Showbiz Tiffany Trump accepts Whoopi Goldberg's invitation to sit next to her at New York Fashion Week Whoopi defended Tiffany, 23, on Wednesday's The View after she was believed to be shunned by fashion editors earlier this week Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Whoopi Goldberg defends Tiffany after fashion show loneliness Share this video Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Tiffany Trump has accepted Whoopi Goldberg's invitation to sit next to her at New York Fashion Week. 
Donald Trump's daughter was reserved a prestigious place on the front row at the Phillip Plein show on Monday – but she ended up cutting a lonely figure. 
Fashion writer Christina Binkley took to Twitter to claim that “nobody” wanted to sit next to the controversial President’s daughter. 
And she claimed that two fashion editors actually “moved” seats to avoid being next to the 23-year-old. Tiffany Trump (Photo: WireImage) 
“Nobody wants to sit next to Tiffany Trump at Philipp Plein, so they moved and the seats by her are empty,” journalist Christina Binkley tweeted. 
She also shared photos of the “empty seats next to Tiffany Trump”. 
However, on Wednesday’s episode of The View Whoopi Goldberg made a point of defending President Trump’s daughter. 
“You know what, Tiffany, I’m supposed to go to a couple more shows. I don’t know what’s going to happen, but I’m coming to sit with you,” she said on the show. 
“Because nobody’s talking politics. You’re looking at fashion! She doesn’t want to talk about her dad! She’s looking at the fashion!” 
After catching wind of Whoopi's comments, Tiffany took to Twitter to say she would love to take up the actress and TV host on her offer. 
Tiffany wrote: "Thank you @WhoopiGoldberg I'd love to sit with you too!" Whoopi Goldberg defended Tiffany on The View (Photo: ITV) Tiffany Trump at fashion week (Photo: WireImage) 
On Wednesday, the designer behind the show also spoke out in Tiffany's defence. 
“Tiffany Trump is not a politician, she’s a teenager,” Philipp Plein told TMZ . 
“Can you blame a daughter for having a father who has the wrong political direction for some people? 
“I’m not here to judge I just think it’s not right to treat someone without respect because she is the daughter of somebody don’t like.” Like us on Facebook
